page.title: 08INTERVIEWS WITH LOCAL PEOPLE
page.content: (1) {Mr Charles Brownsel}(70) a former pupil, discovered that juniors and infants were now taught separately; rooms were heated by gas fired boiler; lunches were cooked on site and infants drank sterilized milk. Children wrote with cartridge pens and learnt from TV and radio. Life had deteriorated considerably. Walking to school was unsafe; punishment 'on the spot' by the local 'Bobby' was abolished and home discipline had become either slack or non-existent. (2){Mrs Sheriff}grandmother and farmers daughter explained there were more cars, trains, planes and subsequently more noise. Children did not help on the land as previously but most people had more money and could buy from the shops what they wanted more easily.
